ygData.subject: Re: Cash flow problems
ygData.msgSnippet: Selling in the warriours guild in Kelethin yeilds better prices than your own Bard guild there?  I always thought the your own guild gave the best prices on
ygData.messageBody:
Selling in the warriours guild in Kelethin yeilds better prices than your
own Bard guild there? I always thought the your own guild gave the best
prices on items.

Gediprime, ( I'll be in Crushbone tonite )
Xegony

----- Original Message -----
From: Abhi Visuvasam <abhi_1999@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 22, 1999 9:25 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Cash flow problems


> From: Abhi Visuvasam <abhi_1999@...>
>
> Greetings Weiland,
>
> I am not an expert at making money, but I have a
> friend who is. Here is some of the advise that he
> gives me. I'm not loot hungry so I probably won't do
> it and it seems like you are not either, but it will
> atleast help you get your banded.
>
> First of all make sure you are hunting a loot heavy
> zone. What I mean is since you are lvl 11, the best
> place for you would be either Crushbone(Kelethin) or
> Splitpaw (South Karanas) or of course the Derv camps.
> I myself am not a big derv fan, because of all the
> camping.
>
> Next make sure you find a party that is high enough
> level to not care about loot in that zone. For
> example find a party of lvl 16+ that will take you in
> as an understudy. That way they will let you loot
> practically everything that comes their way, because
> they probably care more about the exp. Make sure you
> let them know, that these are your intentions. This
> is a an effective, but seldom used technique. I have
> done it a few times and I made about 15-20pp a night.
> But it got old.
>
> Finally don't leave out anything, sell everything. I
> have seen a lot of people get shoulder pads, or
> legionnaire belts or rustys, and I've seen them just
> leave it on the corpse. DON'T! It all adds up. Just
> keep collecting and selling, keep collecting and
> selling. It takes discipline, but in about 3-4 days
> you will be able to afford a full suit of banded.
>
> Oh and one last thing, if you are hunting in
> Crushbone. Make sure you sell at the Warror's guild
> in kelethin, they give great prices.
>
> Ok I hope that helps.
>
> Farewell,
>
> Sedaien Reyvon
> lvl 20 Bard on Solusek Ro
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Message: 5
> Date: Tue, 22 Jun 1999 03:54:29 -0500
> From: "Michal Hobson" <given@...>
> Subject: Cash flow problems
>
> Hail and well met again,
>
> I am requesting the assistance of some of you yet
> again. Tonight I
> finally made the 11th rank. We were in W. Commons
> killing the Derv's
> when lo and behold a werewolf arrived and decimated
> all but 2 of us,
> myself and a ranger friend. Upon zoning to E. Commons
> and then
> returning to the Bard's guild, I came to the
> realization that I needed
> "real" armor. Up to this point, I have been wearing
> all leather. It
> is affordable and light but is not as effective
> against the Derv's and
> such. I NEED BANDED!!!
> And now on to my problem, where do I pick up the
> plat to buy this
> wonderful armor? I seem to only make around 5 pp a
> night at best.
> Would joining a guild help me in this situation? If
> so does anyone no
> any good guilds on Erollisi Marr? I've taken to
> fighting darkweeds but
> there is far too much downtime. The orc cents in my
> area have very
> little loot, so soloing in this area is pretty
> worthless. The derv's
> have lovely loot, but I am afraid of grouping with
> people I don't know.
> Especially in a zone like W. Commons. Tonight they
> actually attacked
> the werewolf!!
> Yesterday someone in my group decided, despite my
> warnings, to walk up
> and slap Lord Shin Ree. What should I do?
>
> Thank you in advance for your advice,
> Weiland of Freeport
> 11th Rank Bard of Erollisi Marr
>
>
